Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: Draws two separate spaces on the paper that might represent different areas (but does not clearly distinguish between land and water habitats).
Includes some basic shapes or scribbles in the drawn spaces that could represent living things.
CANNOT: Does not consistently draw one habitat on land and one in water (student may draw two similar or indistinguishable habitats).
Fails to include or label at least two different kinds of living things in each habitat (student might only include one living thing or none at all).
Shows no clear patterns depicting the diversity of plants in each habitat (student might draw random shapes, mistaking them for plants).
Shows no clear patterns depicting the diversity of animals in each habitat (student might not include animals or only singular, unrelated shapes).
Does not compare or label similar and different living things across habitats (student might not understand comparison or labeling).
